```python
ExceedanceFrequencyLine(
    self,
    result_variable,
    model_uncertainty=True,
    levels=None,
    step_size=0.1,
)
```

Calculate a frequency line for a result variable (e.g. h (waterlevel), hs (significant wave height)) for a location

### calculate { #pydra_core.ExceedanceFrequencyLine.calculate }

```python
ExceedanceFrequencyLine.calculate(input)
```

Execute a calculation

|--------|-------------------------------|---------------|------------|
| input  | Union\[Location, HRDatabase\] | The input     | _required_ |

### calculate_location { #pydra_core.ExceedanceFrequencyLine.calculate_location }

```python
ExceedanceFrequencyLine.calculate_location(location)
```

Calculate the exceedance probability of the variable at a given set of levels. 
If the levels are not specified, they will be chosen at the 1st and 99th percentile of all values in the database.

#### Parameter {.doc-section .doc-section-parameter}

location : Location
    The Location object

#### Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type          | Description                           |
|--------|---------------|---------------------------------------|
|        | FrequencyLine | Frequency line of the result variable |

### set_levels { #pydra_core.ExceedanceFrequencyLine.set_levels }

```python
ExceedanceFrequencyLine.set_levels(levels=None)
```

Change the levels. 
If levels is not defined, the frequency line is calculated based upon the 1st and 99th percentile.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                                         | Default   |
|--------|--------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|
| levels | list   | The levels at which the exceedance probability has to be calculated | `None`    |

```python
ExceedanceFrequencyLine.set_model_uncertainty_steps(model_uncertainty_steps)
```

| Name                    | Type   | Description                       | Default    |

| model_uncertainty_steps | int    | Number of model uncertainty steps | _required_ |

### set_result_variable { #pydra_core.ExceedanceFrequencyLine.set_result_variable }

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

### use_model_uncertainty { #pydra_core.ExceedanceFrequencyLine.use_model_uncertainty }

```python
ExceedanceFrequencyLine.use_model_uncertainty(model_uncertainty)
```

Use model uncertainty when calculating a frequency line.

#### Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name              | Type   | Description                                      | Default    |
|-------------------|--------|--------------------------------------------------|------------|
| model_uncertainty | bool   | Enable or disable the use of model uncertainties | _required_ |
